content: this pattern contains instructions for an alternative bodice to any of the little cotton rabbit dresses including both the small and regular sizes and those included in the animal patterns you can also use this bodice with the instructions in this pattern to make a vest/camisole style top m o r e k n i t t i n g p a t t e r n s a r e a v a i l a b l e a t https //littlecottonrabbits com © copyright 2020 all rights reserved j u l i e w i l l i a m s l i t t l e c o t t o n r a b b i t s page 1 one of my favourite things about making knitted toys is coming up with new designs for their clothing and the idea for this little pattern supplement came about when i was working on designs for my bags baskets and backpacks pattern this is a free supplement pattern that is intended to be used with any of the little cotton rabbit dresses either those included with an animal pattern or the separate dresses patterns instructions are given for both the regular sized 9 inch animal dresses and the small sized dresses that fit the 7 inch animals you will need one of those patterns for the skirt part i ve also included instructions for a simple camisole/vest top that uses the same bodice instructions i hope you enjoy using these patterns to create a wardrobe of different outfits for your knitted animals m a t e r i a l s n o t i o n s yarns 4py/fingering weight yarn a pair of 2 75mm us 2 knitting needles tapestry needle a tiny button cable needle crochet hook for button loop/collar y a r n s u g g e s t i o n s this pattern uses 2 75mm needles with 4ply/fingering weight yarn i prefer to knit the clothing in 4ply cotton/cotton mix yarns cotton yarns are crisp and show off colour-work patterns nicely they also block well and you can even lightly iron cotton knits to smooth out any wrinkles yarns i particularly like are krea deluxe organic cotton bcgarn alba millamia naturally soft cotton phildar phil coton 3 drops safran and dmc natura just cotton as all knit up nicely and have a good range of colours patons 4ply cotton and sirdar 4ply cotton also come in a wide range of colours but are thinner and cascade ultra pima fine has a wonderful range of colours but is a little thicker so if using any of these you will need to check your gauge if the clothes are to fit there is also a blog post here https //littlecottonrabbits com/2020/06/choosing-yarns-for-the-little-cotton-rabbit-animal-patterns-part-2 html which details some of my favourite yarns and what i like about them and it may be worth looking on ravelry to see
